New Records: The Mets set a new record with a game having zero strikeouts in the postseason
The combined margin of victory after five games was 35 runs, a new team record
Key Match Events: The Mets had a game with zero strikeouts, a rare occurrence in the postseason
Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer, one of only two such home runs in Mets' postseason history
The Mets scored 12 runs in a single game, a high number for any team this postseason
Pre-Game Insights: Players and reporters noted the unusual nature of the series, with many blowouts
Mets' Brandon Nimmo and reliever Ryne Stanek expressed the unpredictability of the postseason
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor was unaware of the Mets' no-strikeout game until shown the box score
The series was highlighted as a pivotal moment in the Mets' playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series had five consecutive blowouts, a rare occurrence in postseason history
Shohei Ohtani and other Dodgers' performances contributed to their dominance
The article noted the historical context of such lopsided games in the postseason
Others: The series was compared to past blowouts in MLB history, including the 1965 World Series and 2007 ALCS
